/metadata.summary: Access to the Server's Capability Statement
/metadata.description: All FHIR Servers return a CapabilityStatement that describes what services they perform

get.summary: Return the server's capability statement

/CarePlan.summary: manage the collection of resources of type CarePlan
/CarePlan.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type CarePlan

get.summary: Search all resources of type CarePlan based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The ID of the resource

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: Only return resources which were last updated as specified by the given range

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given tag

parameters.name: activity-reference
parameters.description: Activity details defined in specific resource

parameters.name: care-team
parameters.description: Who's involved in plan?

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Type of plan

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: Health issues this plan addresses

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Time period plan covers

parameters.name: episodeOfCare
parameters.description: EpisodeOfCare

parameters.name: goal
parameters.description: Goal of the care plan

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: External Ids for this plan

parameters.name: instantiates-canonical
parameters.description: Instantiates FHIR protocol or definition

parameters.name: part-of
parameters.description: Part of referenced CarePlan

parameters.name: participant-actor
parameters.description: Reference to the participant

parameters.name: participant-function
parameters.description: The role of the participant

parameters.name: participant-function-actor
parameters.description: A Participant with a specific function and actor

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Who care plan is for

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: draft | active | suspended | completed | entered-in-error | cancelled | unknown

parameters.name: status-history-end-time
parameters.description: end time of historic status change

parameters.name: status-history-start-time
parameters.description: start time of historic status change

parameters.name: status-history-status
parameters.description: status of historic status change

parameters.name: status-scheduled-status
parameters.description: Scheduled status for status change

parameters.name: status-scheduled-time
parameters.description: Scheduled time for status change

parameters.name: team-scheduled-time
parameters.description: Scheduled time for team change

parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given tag

parameters.description: Conditions/problems/diagnoses this episode of care is for

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Business Identifier(s) relevant for this EpisodeOfCare

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The organization that has assumed the specific responsibilities of this EpisodeOfCare

parameters.description: The reference to the actor

parameters.name: participant-function
parameters.description: The role of the participant

parameters.name: participant-function-actor
parameters.description: A Participant with a specific function and actor

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The patient who is the focus of this episode of care

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The current status of the Episode of Care as provided (does not check the status history collection)

parameters.name: status-scheduled-time
parameters.description: Scheduled time for status change

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: The list of practitioners that may be facilitating this episode of care for specific purposes.

parameters.name: team-scheduled-time
parameters.description: Scheduled time for team change

summary.name: _summary
summary.description: Requests the server to return a designated subset of the resource

format.name: _format
format.description: Specify alternative response formats by their MIME-types (when a client is unable acccess accept: header)

pretty.name: _pretty
pretty.description: Ask for a pretty printed response for human convenience

elements.name: _elements
elements.description: Requests the server to return a collection of elements from the resource

count.name: _count
count.description: The maximum number of search results on a page. The server is not bound to return the number requested, but cannot return more
